SENT.plain: BehÃ§et's disease (BD) is a systemic vasculitis, with a more aggressive course in young males
Orogenital ulcers, uveitis and cutaneous lesions are the most frequent manifestations
We analyzed the effects of adalimumab on six patients with BD pretreated with inmunosupressive therapy, two of whom had received infliximab
We observed a good clinical response in all patients
To date, after a mean follow-up of 26.8 months, patients continue receiving adalimumab, with good clinical control, no adverse effects have been reported with adalimumab
